The best First Person Shooter of all time. No competition.... I've beat the game on Windows XP back in 2004, again on the Xbox, then on the 360, & again on my new laptop with my new account. Never gets old. I've always imagined what it would be like if they made this into a feature-length film.... I feel like I'm playing a movie when I play Half Life 2. I don't see how Half Life 3 could possibly top this - or the episodes. Guess we'll see. People say there never will be a Half Life 3.... but they finally announced System Shock 3 -  16 years later. So you never know....
It's okay. Not great, but not bad.

It's a great game, even after more than 10 years later. Surprisingly, it looks even better than i remember, and this fact alone is incredible, considering that usually the games a played years ago usually end up being worse than i remember. The game is mostly silent, but the few moments where the soundtrack is used, you can almost feel like you could beat the whole game heating these songs non-stop and probably not ever get tired of them. Aside from the music, the sound department is mostly okay. They're not incredible, but they work. Still, it's kinda annoying to hear the same breathing sound whenever i try to run. Enemies keep saying the same lines over and over again, civil protection and zombies alike. Story is actually pretty good, with charismatic characters, each with his own unique a fun personality, that makes you care for them. That said, i wish Valve would release sequels to the franchise as a whole, since the story ended up on a huge cliffhanger with no hints of ever being completed.

It's a great game, very polished, which makes it good even to today's standards. I recommend it, but i'm pretty sure everyone played it alredy.

Half Life 2 is the definitve first person shooter, everything is perfect from the engaging story to the step up in graphics compared to half life 1. Also managing to use physics in an engaging way compared to many games which just use physics for bodys/props etc. I also love the gravity gun which completly changes the later half of the game meaning levels like ravenholm are possible to finish whithout ever firing a shot.
The story is also a massive step up over half life 1 featuring Gordon fighting back against the combine and managing to be an engaging story through out its 18 (ish) hour campaign. The guns are all perfect as well from the pistol to the revolver every gun has an important perpose and are all perfectly balanced.
I also love the "minigames" that came with it half life 2 death match is an incredible multi player game but sadly with a dead comunity. There is also Counter strike source which still has a decent player base and is an incredible shooter with a great competitve mode and fun alternatives such as surf and bhop.
Overall should you own half life 2, yes you should have already played and if not take my word for it and go out and play one of the greatest single player and multi player shooters ever also featuring a massive selection of mods
Definitly a 10/10 game.

классная игра советую всем

Äh.... Zensur?

Man bin ich froh, dass ich das Game scheinbar noch nicht früher rezensiert habe.
Das Spiel befindet sich in meiner Steam Bibliothek seit einer Ewigkeit. Ich glaube, ich habs direkt damals 2005 gekauft und ich bin ziemlich Sicher, dass es damals noch unzensiert war.

Als ich es kürzlich wieder spielte, kam mir irgendetwas komisch vor. Ich konnts aber nicht einordnen. Wirklich nur durch puren Zufall brachte ein Telefongespräch mit nem Kollegen die Aufklärung. Er sagte, dass man bei Steam ja nur noch die zensierte HL2 Version kaufen könne, was mich stutzig machte. Nach einem Testspiel bestätigten sich dann all diese dinge, nachdem ich extra mal drauf geachtet hatte. Graues Blut, einige zensierte Cutscenes, Zensur bei der Zerteilung von Zombies mittels Sägeblättern und Leichen verschwinden ziemlich rasch......

Man kann das alles auch bei Schnittberichte.com nachlesen. Lt. diverser Foren soll die nachträgliche Zensur wohl ein "Versehen" gewesen sein, dass beim Update auf die neue Engine passiert sein soll. Dafür hatte man wohl irgendeine kastrierte Version als Vorlage genommen.

Leute, das ist wirklich übel, wenn es nun auch möglich ist, die Leute sogar noch im Nachhinein abzufucken. Und dabei war ich von Steam immer super überzeugt. Aber solche klamotten sind mal wirklich schei*e. Und ich gehe jetzt mal nicht davon aus, dass Steam das wieder richten wird. Sicherlich gibbet da in den AGBs auch irgendeinen schützenden Passus, damit Valve für derart Pannen nicht zur Verantwortung gezogen werden kann.

Man, ich hab SOOOOO nen Hals!
